answers.answer: Hi,How are you? Erectile dysfunction occurs due to medical conditions like hypercholesterolemia, hypertension, diabetes mellitus, hormonal imbalance, drugs like anti-hypertensives, antidepressants, tranquilizers, sedatives etc.It could be possible that erectile dysfunction could be a side effect due to use of lisinopril or due to hypertension it self. Depending upon the cause treatment should be directed.Discuss with your doctor regarding the above mentioned possibilities and follow his advise.Best

question: Dear doctor .during the months of september and october ,I took an ace inhibitor called lisinopril for my high blood pressure. after taking this medication for a few weeks, I started having problems achieving a hard erection. I continued to take this medication for another month. I then went back to the doctor and the doctor gave me a prescription for viagra.My question is will i ever be able to get a hard erection again without using viagra or is the damage done by taking lisinopril permanent.er
title: trouble getting an erection
